fields.value: Replication Data for: Estimation of phenotypic variability in symbiotic nitrogen fixation ability of common bean under drought stress using 15N natural abundance in grain

authorAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT, Universidad Autónoma de Barcelona - UAB
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT
International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

datasetContactAffiliation.value: International Center for Tropical Agriculture - CIAT

dsDescriptionValue.value: A new methodology to estimate phenotypic differences in SNF ability. We used 15N natural abundance method to compare SNF ability estimated from shoot tissue sampled at mid-pod filling growth stage vs. grain tissue sampled at harvest. We suggest that the method of estimating Ndfa using grain tissue (Ndfa-G) could be applied in bean breeding programs to improve SNF ability. Using this method of Ndfa-G, we identified four bean lines (RCB 593, SEA 15, NCB 226 and BFS 29) that combine greater SNF ability with greater grain yield under drought stress and these could serve as potential parents to further improve SNF ability of common bean.

publicationCitation.value: Polania, Jose; Poschenrieder, Charlotte; Rao, Idupulapati Madhusudana; Beebe, Stephen. 2016. Estimation of phenotypic variability in symbiotic nitrogen fixation ability of common bean under drought stress using 15N natural abundance in grain . European Journal of Agronomy 79: 66-73

grantNumberAgency.value: United States Agency for International Development (USAID)
CGIAR research program on grain legumes

files.description: Evaluation of SNF and other shoot traits in 36 bean genotypes under irrigated and drought conditions in two years 2012 and 2013
